comment.text: Necessary for the catabolism of N-linked carbohydrates released during glycoprotein turnover. Cleaves all known types of alpha-mannosidic linkages.
Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing alpha-D-mannose residues in alpha-D-mannosides.

isoform.text: Gene prediction based on EST data.

comment.text: First processed into 3 peptides of 70 kDa, 42 kDa (D) and 13/15 kDa (E). The 70 kDa peptide is further processed into three peptides (A, B and C). The A, B and C peptides are disulfide-linked.

disease.name: Mannosidosis, alpha B, lysosomal
disease.description: A lysosomal storage disease characterized by accumulation of unbranched oligosaccharide chains. This accumulation is expressed histologically as cytoplasmic vacuolation predominantly in the CNS and parenchymatous organs. Depending on the clinical findings at the age of onset, a severe infantile (type I) and a mild juvenile (type II) form of alpha-mannosidosis are recognized. There is considerable variation in the clinical expression with mental retardation, recurrent infections, impaired hearing and Hurler-like skeletal changes being the most consistent abnormalities.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 38 family.

comment.name: Mendelian genes mannosidase, alpha, class 2B, member 1 (MAN2B1)
